prompt: <description>Part 1: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The first part is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. This part will be constructed using a parametric CAD model with a single sketch. 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the following parameters for the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Generate a 2D sketch (face_1).** This sketch will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system selected in the previous step. 3. **Create a loop (loop_1) in the following sequence:** - Draw a line (line_1) from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.0217, 0.0] - Draw a line (line_2) from point [0.0217, 0.0] to point [0.0217, 0.0434] - Draw a line (line_3) from point [0.0217, 0.0434] to point [0.0, 0.0434] - Close the loop by drawing a line (line_4) from point [0.0, 0.0434] to point [0.0, 0.0] Loop_1 has 4 lines. 4. **Prepare the scaled 2D sketch for 3D transformation.** Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.0434 (sketch_scale). 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D.** Use the euler angles (-90.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] for this transformation. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** The extrusion depths are as follows: - Towards the normal: 0.0 - Opposite the normal: 0.75 The final dimensions of Part 1 are as follows: - Height: 0.0434 - Width: 0.75 - Length: 0.0434 Proceed with constructing the next part by following the JSON file.</description>
